item.title: Install Repository
item.description: Bootstrap sudo apt -y install curl apt-transport-https gnupg2 curl 'https://keybase.io/mrstaker/pgp_keys.asc?fingerprint=C8FF9465DC43E057F5D592EEC190D4B4328516A1' | sudo apt-key add - echo 'deb [arch=amd64] https://deb.staker.ltd stable main' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/staker.list sudo apt update n.b If Keybase doesn’t work (because it’s rate limited, for example), you can try our backup instructions: sudo apt -y install curl apt-transport-https gnupg2 curl 'https://keys.openpgp.org/vks/v1/by-fingerprint/C8FF9465DC43E057F5D592EEC190D4B4328516A1' | sudo apt-key add - echo 'deb [arch=amd64] https://deb.staker.ltd stable main' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/staker.list sudo apt update Install repository package sudo apt -y install staker-repo The repository package bundles the following:

item.title: Install Elrond Packages
item.description: Elrond Networks We produce three flavours for our packages: elrond-main - targeting Elrond Mainnet. elrond-test - targeting Elrond Testnet. elrond-dev - targeting Elrond Devnet. These packages are built using our elrond build-pkg build environment, then signed and published by our repo-mgr tool. # installs our latest elrond-test package sudo apt install elrond-test # check which versions are available apt-cache madison elrond-test elrond-test | 1.1.51 | https://deb.staker.ltd stable/main amd64 Packages elrond-test | 1.

item.title: Install ZFS Packages
item.description: ZFS ZFS is a centrepiece on our storage design. BtrFS is not there yet. item.title: Install Miscellaneous Packages
item.description: createrepo createrepo is our build of createrepo_c made specifically for Ubuntu 20.04. This opens up the possibility for managing our rpm repository without the need of containers or virtual machines. sudo apt install createrepo # system and version info cat /etc/issue Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS \n \l createrepo -V Version: 0.17.1 (Features: LegacyWeakdeps )

item.title: Uninstall Repository
item.description: Procedure We’re sorry to see you go. Please provide feedback if you ran into difficulties and this is the reason for removing our package builds. We make it easy for you to remove everything: sudo apt autoremove --purge staker-repo That’s it. It removes all our packages, GPG keyring, and configuration files. It won’t remove the configuration files which you created as we have no way of tracking that.
